captions.text:
So Sharon finally started watching Game Of
Thrones.
Yeah, I know right?

She's kinda pissed at me for spoiling that
one bit...
It's no big deal though, is it?
Waah!
Amy Jenkins!
What did you do to my room!?

You are hereby accused of breaking fan code
1B.

The highest offence of the social ethics order
after insulting one's ship:
Mouthing of a spoiler!
*mumbling*

She ruined the best minute and a half of my
existence!

oh my GOD, SHARON that spoiler was 3 years
old!
(GASP)

There IS no Statute of Limitations on Game
of Thrones spoilers!

You will now be presented before the honorable
Fandom Judge.

Fandom Judge? You see, this is the kind of
thing that make people hate us-
SILENCE!
I present to you...
The mother of fandoms,
First of her name,
Queen of fiction,
Breaker of tropes.
Linda, honorable judge of house Schwartz
Step Forward.

Ughh.. I knew I should've joined the gamer
girls instead.

You are accused of spoiling a recent episode
of Game of Thrones.
NOT RECENT! Season 1.
Who here could possibly not know about.. OW!

Oh my god! you watch Game of Thrones? YAY!
I love that show!
(sarcasticly) I never would've guessed.
That's so cool!

Well anyway, I don't really care about spoilers
myself,

but it's pretty frowned upon over here...
so...
Death.
HUH??
Shame. She was a good fan.
You know,

This kind of reminds me of that scene where
they killed...

in the fourth season of Walking Dead.﻿

comments.author: The Kats

comments.text:
I feel like there are limitations to some spoilers. Like for Harry Potter I 
think there is a ten year wait. Because it is always a good book for every 
generation. Games, like if a character died, I feel like it is 3 years 
since the next installment of a series of games usually comes out then. But 
if it is like Game of Thrones with a 10+ years since the books came out and 
still continuing and that you don't know what is happening or who dies, 
there is no limitations. My youngest sister who is a sophomore is old 
enough to pick up the books to read and I feel like I can't talk about 
anything GoT related for she will hurt me if I spoil something. But I agree 
with the "I don't mind spoilers." That's not gonna stop me from 
reading/watching the show.﻿

comments.author: Anna Brown

comments.text:
I have always loved your work, but I just started messing around with an 
animating program and wanted to look at examples to get an idea of style 
constraints and what was possible. You were the first person I thought of 
and HOLY CRAP! Now that I have a bit of a better idea of what goes into 
this medium I just keep staring at all of the details- the motion of the 
hair and the amount that the lips move! These sketches are hilarious and 
beautifully done and I just want to say thank you for putting in so much 
time and sharing your talent with us. : J﻿
